poem:
**Anania's Dance**

In pixelated halls, joy unfurls,  
Anania's lens on rainbow twirls;  
Questions spark like digital flares,  
Pop stars, politicians—queer affairs.  
In laughter's grasp, culture blooms,  
Defying boxes, genre looms.  
A stage, a screen, each viral thread,  
In unity's glow, no lines to tread.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘It’s queer, Black joy’: the TikTok creator quizzing pop stars and politicians on LGBTQ+ culture Anania Williams is genreless. Some may know them from their comedic TikTok videos, which regularly amass hundreds of thousands of views. Others may recognize them as host of Gaydar, a viral entertainment-education show about queer culture, history and current events; an interview Williams did with the New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani did go viral, after all. There’s also". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
